# Chapter 125

The Pope's voice cracked across the temple. "Do you know who I am? I am Pope Drevigo! Parent to seventy million believers, agent of the Goddess herself. The most sacred being in this world! You dare point a sword at me? Infidel, you aren't afraid of divine punishment?"

Grid listened. His jaw worked. When he spoke, his voice was flat. "You spat at me."

"W-What? Disgraceful wretch!"

Color flooded the Pope's face. A paladin aiding the traitor was bad enough. Now this. The old man's head turned crimson with rage.

"I will punish you myself! Don't think about leaving here alive!"

Grid's gaze stayed cold. "You keep talking about divine punishment." He tilted his head. "Pope. You haven't grasped the situation yet? I came here to inflict divine punishment on you. You're the one who will be punished. Not me. So maybe act a little better? Tsk."

The Pope wasn't the only one annoyed. Grid felt it too. If this old bastard had been normal, the quest would've been simple. Get the pavranium blessed. Leave. But no. The Pope was corrupt, the Church was rotting, and now Grid had to deal with a quest that kept shifting under his feet.

"The introduction from my father-in-law is useless." Grid's fingers tightened on Dainsleif's grip. "This is really annoying."

*Peeng!*

He squeezed harder. The blade hummed. Then he aimed at the Pope.

The Pope launched light magic.

*Kwa kwang!*

White flash met black flash. The collision tore ten meters of carpet to ash. Red fragments drifted down like angry eyes.

*My sword was blocked?*

Grid's blade had the red lightning enhancement. Damian's buffs layered on top. The fact that it didn't pierce the Pope's magic meant the old man's power exceeded Grid's current attack.

*My attack power right now is higher than Malacus' magic. Malacus couldn't stop me even with a three-layer shield.*

It didn't make sense. Grid's insight showed the Pope at 24,000 combat power. Damian sat at 12,500 as a level 227 ranker. By pure numbers, two Damians should overpower the Pope.

*The Tzedakah Guild averaged 12,000 combat power during the Malacus raid.*

Seventeen members. Twelve thousand each. Over 200,000 combined. Yet Malacus had crushed them. Which meant Malacus should've been near 200,000 combat power. The Pope at 24,000 should be ten times weaker.

But after that exchange, the Pope felt stronger than Malacus.

*Well.*

Grid's insight sharpened. The concept clicked into place.

*A small gap in combat power is actually a massive cliff to climb.*

One ant versus a praying mantis. Two ants don't win. They die.

Combat power wasn't 1+1=2.

It was 1+1 < 2.

That's how seventeen guild members got overwhelmed by one Malacus.

"The sum means nothing," Grid muttered. "Seventeen cats can't beat an elephant. And the Pope is a predator that devours elephants." He smiled. "Strong."

"Cat? Elephant?" The Pope frowned. "What are you babbling about?"

Grid's smile widened. "I'm either a cat or an elephant. Let's find out which."

"Are you insane?"

"Don't worry about it."

Grid wasn't discouraged. His blood heated. *Let's see how far I can push this.*

He'd learned control during the Guardian raid. What he lacked in raw power, he could compensate with precision.

*Pepeng! Pepepeng!*

Dainsleif blurred through different angles. Each sword aura flew on a separate orbit. Front. Side. Rear. Unless the Pope had eyes everywhere, he couldn't intercept them all.

Grid grinned.

The Pope was better than expected. Light magic unfolded in rapid succession, swatting down each energy blade.

"Useless!" The Pope thrust both hands forward.

*Kwa kwa kwa kwang!*

White magic spread like noon sun. It shattered every black energy sword in the air.

"Wow." Grid watched the brilliant light fade. He actually admired it. "Really strong."

Was he discouraged?

No.

"Okay! Time to get serious!"

Pagma's Descendant had a unique buff. Self-only. But the effect was insane.

"**Blacksmith's Rage**!"

> [**Blacksmith's Rage** has been activated. Your attack power and attack speed will increase significantly for 20 seconds.]

"Ohhhh!"

*Pepepeng! Pepepepeng!*

Grid doubled his sword speed. His arms became a blur.

*Kwa kwa kwa kwang!*

Attacks fell like heavy rain. No pause. No break.

"Hah..."

The Pope's face drained of color. He fired light magic continuously, but the speed couldn't match Grid's onslaught. He released another wide-area burst.

This time, the result changed.

*Kwa kwa kwa kwang!*

Blacksmith's Rage amplified the energy swords. They tore through the light magic. Then they landed on the Pope's body.

"You became stronger? Kuaaaaak!"

The light shattered. The swords hit again and again. The Pope's scream echoed through the hall.

> [You have dealt 13,300 damage.]
> [You have dealt 13,910 damage.]
> [You have dealt 14,080 damage.]
> [The Best Gauntlets option effect is activated, causing you to attack the target twice.]
> [You have dealt 28,300 damage.]
> [Critical!]
> [You have dealt 31,050 damage.]

The Pope's health bar plummeted. Grid compared damage to the remaining gauge.

*Around 300,000 total?*

The Guardian had over 1.2 million. But that was a golem. The Pope was human. Lower inherent health. This boosted Grid's confidence.

*Twenty more hits?*

He might not need Isabel after all.

"Puhahahat! The pope should die and drop some items!" Grid laughed as victory loomed. He attacked relentlessly. The health gauge dropped to a quarter. Then Transcend and Blacksmith's Rage ran out.

"I'll finish it here!"

The Pope was dying. His white garments embroidered with gold thread hung in tatters. Grid closed the distance. Ten meters in seconds. He triggered his strongest skill.

"Pagma's Swordsmanship, **Kill**!"

*Kuooooh!*

Killing intent thickened the air. Dark haze wrapped Dainsleif. The blade drove toward the Pope's heart.

"Goddess' Breath...!"

The Pope cast magic. His health bar refilled instantly.

*A heal that restores hundreds of thousands of health?*

But the magic didn't stop there. A green translucent shield unfolded. It completely neutralized Kill.

Grid's stomach dropped. "What skill is this? Damn. Is he a guardian knight?"

The Pope had an invincible skill meant only for guardian knights. Grid backpedaled.

The Pope sneered. "The Goddess' divine blessing fully protects my body and soul. No matter what you do, you can't harm me!"

The Pope was fundamentally a priest. If Rebecca's Daughters were peak paladins, the Pope was the peak priest. His bloody body restored. He cast a broad heal on the wounded paladins who'd withdrawn. Then he pointed.

"What are you doing? Kill that infidel immediately!"

"..."

The paladins didn't like the Pope. They didn't want to follow an existence that corrupted their church. But depraved or not, he was the Goddess' agent. The high-ranking paladins were deeply religious. They couldn't imagine refusing his order.

They grabbed their weapons. They rushed Grid simultaneously.

"Damian!" Grid barked, eyes darting between opponents. "What are you doing? Just watching?"

Damian, who'd been frozen in shock at Grid's display, snapped back to awareness.

"I'm sorry!"

*A level 150 overwhelmed the Pope. What the hell is Grid's identity?*

Despite his confusion, Damian threw his weight behind Grid. He had to defend Rin.

*Chaaeng! Chaeng chaeng!*

Damian blocked a paladin's sword with his shield and counterattacked. His blade bit sharp. The paladins struggled to defend. Blood began to flow.

Damian had awakened during this quest. He'd received the strongest buff skill. He was now strong enough to overpower the Church's senior paladins.

Neither Damian nor Grid knew it, but Damian had surpassed Toban, the first-ranked paladin. He couldn't defeat twenty-three paladins alone. But he could tie them up for a while.

"Good! I'll leave this to you!"

Grid decided Damian was enough. He rushed the Pope again.

The Pope blasted him with light magic.

*Pepeng! Kwa kwa kwa kwang!*

The bombardment concentrated on Grid. He wanted to dodge, but the Pope had read his movement patterns. His reaction rate. The light magic came efficient and precise.

"Ack!"

*Pepeng!*

A white ray passed over Grid's head. Another aimed at his face without pause.

*Jeeeong!*

Grid threw up the Divine Shield.

> [The durability of the Divine Shield has decreased by 78.]

*Crazy!*

The Divine Shield was famous for its resistance to dark magic. But even without that feature, the shield had excellent defense. Yet the Pope's blow reduced durability by an eighth.

*If only I was holding the legendary rated Divine Shield!*

He needed to kill the Pope quickly. Reclaim the legendary shield. Grid kept the shield raised and pushed forward.

"How dare an infidel carry our battle gear! Disgraceful!"

*Kwaang! Kwaang! Kwaang!*

Every step forward, a ray struck the Divine Shield. The metal warped. Cracks spread. On Grid's seventh step, the Pope prepared to shatter the shield completely.

Grid had no intention of letting that happen.

*Peeng!*

He tracked the white flash's approach. Put away the Divine Shield. Armed himself with the Ideal Dagger. Used Wind Blast.

Swirling wind twisted the flash's orbit. The ray grazed Grid's cheek.

*Jjejeok!*

Part of the Frostlight Orc Chief's Helmet cracked. A sliver of Grid's face showed through. He endured it.

"This works."

The Pope ground his teeth. "You still have tricks left!"

That explosion should've blown Grid's head off. The Pope prepared another attack. Two golden discs appeared from nowhere and slammed into his back.

"Kuk?"

The Pope's eyes went wide.

Grid used Quick Movements. He closed the gap. Fired Pagma's Swordsmanship, **Link**.

*Pipit! Pipipipipi!*

The dagger attacked incomparably faster than the greatsword. Quick Movements maximized his agility.

Grid unleashed twenty-two strikes with the Ideal Dagger. Each dealt less damage than Dainsleif. But the dagger's delicate control meant every hit landed.

"Kuaaaak! You!"

The Pope screamed and counterattacked. His magic aimed precisely at Grid's heart.

*Peeng!*

"No!" Damian's scream cut through the temple. Grid's health had dropped by more than half. A single strike.

*Stun.*

Players who lost over 40% health in one hit got stunned. Unprotected. Damian wanted to rush over. Give healing. Give protection. But the paladins blocked him.

*This is the end! The quest will fail! I can't save Rin-chan!*

Then something strange happened.

Grid took no potion. Yet his health recovered. He remained unaffected by any status effect.

Grid coolly plunged his dagger deep into the Pope's heart.
